content.description: Begin with LH on a crimp rail and RH on a side pull/undercling. Hit a slanted crimp on the lip with your LH and hop to a RH crimp on the lip. Match and pull yourself over the mantle crux.
content.protection: pads. spotters highly recommended, the landing is very sloped.
content.location: The west most boulder in the Ramada cluster. This route is on the south facing side of the boulder.

content.description: Begin matched on a horn-like hold on the middle of the boulder and with a foot out right. Hit a RH side pull and grab a LH side pull to compress. Bring the feet under you and bump the RH slightly higher to another side pull. Set the feet and commit to the toss to the lip. Topout with a crimp and by walking the feet out left.
content.location: On the east facing side of the cluster. This route climbs the middle of this boulder.

content.description: Begin left on the sloper rail and ride it with a left heel. Grab either a RH pinch or RH crimp on the face and pull yourself up to the lip. Top out right.
content.protection: ideally one pad and a blubber/thin pad to protect the rock near your back for the start.
content.location: On the backside of the testosterone replacement therapy (trt) boulder.

content.description: Start with a low RH side pull and a LH crimp. Place the feet and bump the RH out to the slimper rail. Match the rail and make a move to the positive slot above. Match and move out right on good holds. Gaston to a decent crimp on the north side of the boulder and gain some crimp dishes.
content.location: On the NE side of the cluster.

content.description: Group of large boulders at the most north end of the parking roundabout.
